intro: Erigeron philadelphicus var. philadelphicus, commonly known as New England aster, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn, consist of purple to blue ray florets surrounding a yellow disk. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for native gardens.
